py_sim.path_planning.graph_search module¶

graph_search.py provides the utilities required for searching a graph to find a plan

py_sim.path_planning.graph_search.GraphType¶

Defines a type for using a graph with bound of nx.Graph

Type:

TypeVar

class py_sim.path_planning.graph_search.DirectedPathGraph¶

Bases: PathGraph[DiGraph]

A directed graph default for the PathGraph

class py_sim.path_planning.graph_search.PathGraph(graph: GraphType)¶

Bases: Generic[GraphType]

Provides an interface to networkx graph creation to ensure that

node position information and edge weights are appropriately defined for graph search methods

graph¶

The graph over which the search is performed

Type:

GraphType

node_location¶

Maps from the node number to the node position (shape (2,))

Type:

dict[int, npt.NDArray[Any]]

rtree¶

rtree used for rapid nearest neighbor searching

Type:

Index

_last_index¶

Stores a counter for node indices

Type:

int

add_edge(node_1: int, node_2: int, weight: float | None = None) → bool¶
Adds the edge into the graph with the optional weight. If no weight is provided

then euclidean distance between the nodes is used

Parameters:

  • node_1 – First node in the edge

  • node_2 – Second node in the edge

Output:

bool: True if the edge was added, false if the nodes do no exist in the graph (thus not added)

add_node(position: TwoDimArray) → int¶

Adds a node given the position. The node location is assumed unique, but not checked

Parameters:

position – the physical (x,y) location of the node

Returns:

The node index added

Return type:

int

add_node_and_edges(position: TwoDimArray, world: World, n_connections: int = 1) → int¶

Adds a node as well as edges to all other nodes that do not intersect with the obstacles

Parameters:

  • position – Node position to be added

  • world – Polygon world used to check for obstacles

  • n_connections – The number of connections to add

Returns:

The index for the node added

Return type:

int

calculate_path_length(nodes: list[int]) → float¶

Calculates the length of the path through a graph

Parameters:

nodes – ordered list of indices for the nodes in the graph

Returns:

path length

Return type:

float

convert_to_cartesian(nodes: list[int]) → tuple[list[float], list[float]]¶

Converts a list of nodes into x and y vectors

Parameters:

nodes – Node indices to be converted

Returns:

x_vec: List of x indices

y_vec: List of y indices

Return type:

tuple[list[float], list[float]]

get_edge_weight(node_1: int, node_2: int) → float¶

Returns the stored weight of the edge

Parameters:

  • node_1 – parent node

  • node_2 – child node

Returns:

The stored weight of the edge

Return type:

float

get_node_position(node: int) → TwoDimArray¶

Returns the position of the given node

Parameters:

node – index of the node being evaluated

Returns:

The position of the node

Return type:

TwoDimArray

nearest(point: TwoDimArray, n_nearest: int = 1) → tuple[list[ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]], list[int]]¶

Finds the n_nearest neighbors to the given point

Parameters:

  • point – Point around which to find the nearest neighbors

  • n_nearest – The number of nearest neighbors to find

Returns:

nearest_points: A list of the nearest neighbors found. Each is a (2,) array

Can be more than n_nearest if points are equidistant Can be less than n_nearest if there are less points

nearest_ind: The corresponding indices

Return type:

tuple[list[npt.NDArray[Any]], list[int]]

node_count() → int¶

Returns the number of nodes in the graph

remove(node: int) → None¶

Removes the node from the graph if it exists

Parameters:

node – Index of the node to be removed

remove_edge(node_1: int, node_2: int) → None¶

Removes the edge, if it exists

Parameters:

  • node_1 – Index of the first node in the edge to be removed

  • node_2 – Index of the second node in the edge to be removed

class py_sim.path_planning.graph_search.UndirectedPathGraph¶

Bases: PathGraph[Graph]

An undirected graph default for the PathGraph

class py_sim.path_planning.graph_search.World(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Protocol

Defines the intersection method required for the path graph

intersects_obstacle(edge: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], shrink_edge: bool = False, edge_shrink_dist: float = 0.001) → bool¶

Determines whether an edge intersects an obstacle, returns true if it does

Parameters:

  • edge – 2x2 matrix of points where each point is a column

  • shrink_edge – True implies that the edge points will be moved towards each other before checking for intersection. This allows, for example, the edge points to lie on the obstacle

  • edge_shrink_dist – The distance that the edges will be moved towards each other

Returns:

True if the edge intersects the obstacles, false if it does not

Return type:

bool
